title: Chinese Pork with Vegetables

ingredients.content: 600 g pork fillet, sliced (0.5 cm x 1 cm x 5 cm)
1 tsp fresh root ginger, freshly grated
150 g red onions, cut in wedges
150 g red peppers, sliced (0.5 cm x 5 cm)
150 g carrots, sliced (0.5 cm x 5 cm)
150 g baby pak choi, roughly chopped

preparations.content: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in pork fillet and 30 g soy sauce. Remove bowl from lid, mix well with spatula then cover and set aside in fridge to marinate for 15-20 minutes.
Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in rice noodles then set aside. Drain pork through simmering basket.
Place 15 g oil and 300 g drained pork in mixing bowl then brown <b>High Temp.<b>. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
Again place 15 g oil and remaining drained pork in mixing bowl.then brown <b>High Temp. <b>. Transfer to bowl with browned pork, set aside to keep warm.
Place remaining 20 g oil and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add grated ginger, red onions, red peppers and carrots then sauté <b>High Temp.<b> .

Add 80 g water, Chinese five spice, sugar, remaining 20 g soy sauce, oyster sauce, mangetout and baby pak choi, mix well using spatula then cook <b>5 min/120°C//speed <b>. Transfer to bowl with browned pork, mix gently with spatula then set aside to keep warm.

Place 1200 g water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl then boil <b>Kettle<b> . Pour over rice noodles in large bowl and allow to soak for the time indicated on packet. Drain through Varoma dish then transfer to a large serving bowl. Arrange reserved meat and vegetables over rice noodles and serve garnished with red chilli, roasted cashew nuts and spring onions.

hintsAndTricks: Chinese flavours are a crowd pleaser for family and friends, and popular with all ages. Stir-fry this tasty and colourful pork dish in your Thermomix for a popular weekend lunch or a special dinner.
